item.title: OGE Online Workshop to Offer Tips for Dissertation, Thesis Preparation and Submission
item.description: Wednesday, February 5, 2025 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Learn the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles. This workshop is for any student who will be writing an MS thesis or PhD dissertation, so be sure to register and bring your questions!

item.title: “It’s Your Final Semester — Now What?” to be Topic of ISSS Workshop
item.description: Date: Monday, February 10, 2025 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Join Rensselaer’s Office of International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) for a virtual workshop to learn about the F-1 immigration options for life after graduation. Topics will include employment, continuing one’s studies, departing the U.S., and more.

item.title: MANE to Hold Graduate Programs Information Sessions
item.description: During the month of February, attend an information session to learn about exciting research opportunities, program requirements, funding options and application processes to MANE’s Co-terminal, traditional and part-time Master’s programs, and the Accelerated BS-PhD program. Sessions will be offered in JEC 3117 on February 6, 11 and 26.

item.title: AI/ML Research Reading Group Meetings to Begin January 22
item.description: The group’s goal is to read and discuss diverse research papers in the interdisciplinary areas of AI/ML/NLP, IS, and HCI. Whether you’re a novice or a seasoned researcher, all RPI members are welcome to join and contribute to our discussions, so, starting January 22, plan to join the group biweekly from 11am to 12pm on Wednesdays in Carnegie 113! Please contact Lydia Manikonda if you have questions.

item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 5, 2025 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Titled “Poisoned City: Flint’s Water Crisis,” this discussion will explore how it came to be that a Great Lakes city learned that its own water was a threat; the Flint water crisis was a man-made disaster that, in many ways, is still unresolved.

item.title: As of 02/12/2025, RPI managed computers will lock after 15 minutes of inactivity
item.description:
Starting 02/12/2025, RPI managed computers will lock after an activity time out of 15 minutes. Devices unused for 15 minutes will be locked requiring your login password to unlock. This measure complies with data privacy regulations to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information if an individual leaves their computer unattended, ensuring that only the authorized individual can access the system by requiring a password to log back in after the inactivity period.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
